body:
[
![E0EetUdXsAIBhK5 resized resized](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/121914885-f8bb1080-cd32-11eb-898b-fa39bae7a331.jpeg)](https://mobile.twitter.com/EtienneBerthie2/status/1387426262306656265)

> Summary 
> We have redesigned the question on household appliances, asking for a list of appliances rather than an annual expense, and made the calculations more reliable
> we have launched on the home page the function `conference`
&gt 
> This release note borrows the name of the research work that analyzed the evolution of more than 200 000 terrestrial glaciers by analyzing satellite images. [More info here](https://mobile.twitter.com/EtienneBerthie2/status/1387426288646987777)

## Footprint of the appliance

We move from a monetary factor to a list of possessions.

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-06-14 17-09-17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/121915179-446dba00-cd33-11eb-8406-1eb0828a0e7d.png)

So we were probably overestimating the default footprint of appliances by a lot, as noted [here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/issues/948) 

Conversely, in this new version, the user is prevented from forgetting recent purchases, as he is offered a list not complete, but already quite full 

We were overestimating the footprint of household appliances as well because it was attributed entirely to the individual. We now divide it by the number of inhabitants of the dwelling 

## Launching the conference mode in the foreground

The feature is now open to everyone, on the home page 

It allows friends, colleagues and workgroups to interactively calculate their footprint together.

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-06-14 17-10-04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/121915284-5ea79800-cd33-11eb-8530-fe334eef9cd7.png)

A new guide allows you to understand the principle before getting started.

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-06-14 17-11-06](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/121915462-8434a180-cd33-11eb-850f-9b7fd909639b.png)

Room names in French are automatically generated to avoid having to worry about finding a name.

Other bugs in the /conference mode have been fixed.

body:
[Glacier du Tour](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/50/Glacier_du_Tour_2021.jpg/270px-Glacier_du_Tour_2021.jpg)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier_du_Tour)
*The Glacier du Tour is located in the Chamonix valley, a valley accessible thanks to a superb mountain TER*


## Unpack your wardrobe

Finally, we no longer ask you the question of *expenditure* on textiles each year, which was too sensitive to the quality of the purchases. Instead of counting 50kg CO2e for a t-shirt bought for 100‚Ç¨, we count the t-shirt's footprint.

In return, it is up to you to catalog what you buy in general each year (or on average each year). A not so simple exercise... but rather interesting, no?

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-08-24 08-57-41](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130571129-d0be75f2-989a-4f84-858d-0c8ce803e561.png)


## Subcategories visualization

As you go through the questions in the simulation, view the footprint of the subcategories at a glance.

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-08-24 08-48-31](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130569828-bee5d46a-0709-4e8a-ab6b-f94f54bbdf0d.png)

## Help notifications to understand the questions

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-08-24 08-49-12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130569970-663eb9ac-4647-4943-b4de-befb12bcb7e2.png)

## Back button

We had removed this button because it was leading to bugs, questions were skipping and definitely falling into the void. After many requests, it is back and normally, free of bugs!

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-08-24 08-51-19](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130570246-0bebdfc3-4fae-40c8-9011-6999713fdcf9.png)

## For those who heat with oil üõ¢Ô∏è

We have quietly changed the main input from kWh to liters 
There is of course always the option to enter the price, we estimate the consumption in liters at the quarterly rates published by the ministry.

## New personas.

We have not communicated much on this feature, but nosgestesclimat is equipped with a page `Personas`, which allows you to put yourself in the shoes of any individual to see their simulation result. It is here, and we added some: nosgestesclimat.fr/personas

> This page, improved, could become very important in the future: the personas could be designed to be representative of the French.

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-08-24 08-54-43](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130570763-0101210c-3f08-49af-b376-572b649ad5d4.png)

## Various improvements

We always listen carefully to your feedback! 

### Input aids

we have improved the input help for those who don't take the plane every year ([details here](
https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/commit/e3d74925b8ff31d6cf40531e6a07a1f97c9f1237)), and accommodation to accommodate less traditional lifestyles (camping car, truck, barge, [details here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/commit/e900598708402620bc3664500db4c1d111f24515).

### End screen

We added the decimal in the final score of the test on the end screen

![ngc-fin-d√©cimale](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130571538-ff8753ce-78c6-4d64-a63c-9128c015545e.gif)

body:
[![Taconnaz Glacier](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c8/Taconnaz.JPG/576px-Taconnaz.JPG)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier_de_Taconnaz)

> In brief 
> - redesign of the action path üéØ: slip actions into your cart to reduce your footprint 
> - the fish menu üêüÔ∏è has finally arrived! 
> - a new permanent menu makes it easier to navigate
> - you can now share your conference links with a QRcode

## A new path to action üéØ

Many users were complaining about the simplicity of our move-to-action path. We've redesigned it entirely, making it more like a mini-game where the goal is to reduce your footprint 

![ngc-action-2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/139829768-5759d428-1e0d-4c7d-9fd3-682dbebb1b90.gif)

This is just the beginning - we already have [next steps](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/issues/359) planned to make it even easier to engage.

We are also introducing *personas*: typical profiles that you can select to experience the action path as a given citizen 

## Menu üêüÔ∏è

We've received dozens of requests to include a fish menu on the diet choice screen. There are now 2 of them! 

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-11-02 11-29-03](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/139830102-bd7cee54-c1fd-454c-8eb0-7ce2a750ffa8.png)

These new dishes have been made from the [Agribalyse] database (https://agribalyse.fr/), and the calculation is of course *open*. A lot of news about food will follow 

## A new menu for the application 

Nosgestesclimat is designed to be used on mobile as on desktop. The mobile version now has a permanent menu at the bottom of the screen, and the desktop version of a new arrangement in two columns, with a menu also present on the left 

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-11-02 11-31-33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/139830463-203c8896-0eda-49ad-ba45-be1a19e180de.png)

This new menu makes the application more accessible, and it's just one of many accessibility improvements we have [planned](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/issues/350).

## The French average is now 9 tons! 

Unfortunately, this does not reflect unexpected efforts, but an improvement in the calculation method of the Ministry of the Environment 

The good news is that the French administration is taking the subject seriously, improving its calculations and explaining the differences in a scientific way 

Detailed explanations [here](https://twitter.com/maeool/status/1453282887583866885).

So why do we show an average of 9.8 tons in the simulator? Because our calculation is made using another method than the government one, complementary. More information [here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/issues/365#issuecomment-957321261).


## Conference mode improvements üèüÔ∏è

This collective mode of using ourgestesclimate is more and more used. To facilitate the sharing of the link at the beginning of the conference, we generate a great QRCode that you just have to project or send by mail
![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-11-02 11-32-27](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/139830597-63fe1856-5622-4c52-b7f4-23ccbfaa6bd9.png) 

Another improvement, we exclude from the group results the simulations that resulted in a too high footprint, above 100 tons. This limit will be configurable soon 

## Technical improvements üêá

We continue to make the site lighter, removing a graphic animation library (react-spring) and better cutting out the conference mode from the rest of the application 

Of course, many reported bugs have also been fixed.
name: Taconnaz

body:
[![periades](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/116311567-ac7c3700-a7ab-11eb-8f01-8d486e2706f3.jpeg)](https://fr.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier_des_P√©riades)



> In summary 
> - new issues and model for considering age and housing materials
> - lots of new climate gestures
> a conference mode in preparation, already testable
> bugs solved

## Age of housing

Previously, a house built in 1901 had a yearly construction footprint, as much as a house built in 2019. Ouch. That's corrected 

 -  age of the house -> whether or not a footprint is taken into account, the houses > 50 years old are now at zero
 -  declination house vs apartment
 -  declination traditional construction (concrete I think) vs eco-built

See https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/994

## Lots of new gestures to take action :boxing_glove 

Which brings us to a good 20!

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-04-27 17-51-06](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/116272451-32cf5380-a781-11eb-8601-0e6ac7e83f9e.png)

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-04-27 17-51-13](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/116272430-2d720900-a781-11eb-9786-e09c5f5e8fcc.png)

But also 
- switch to LEDs at home
- go without the car for trips < 5km
- give up the tumble dryer
- replace my gas boiler by oil

After a last salvo, we will move on to improving the UX of this "climate action" part.


## A "conference" mode in preparation

On the PR number [222](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/222), you can follow the progress of a brand new simulation mode for our climate gestures : make the simulation with several people ! 

It will be useful for conferences, for workshops, but also to simply test with friends.

To test it, [it's here üèπ üèπ](https://conf--nosgestesclimat.netlify.app/conf√©rence)

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-04-27 17-59-21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/116273752-5515a100-a782-11eb-8483-c378c2c7406e.png)



## Bonus : obsolescence of computer equipment

We have at heart to fight against the digital footprint by not neglecting the devices that have a lower definition than the current standard. Here is a small improvement that goes in this direction: https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/issues/995

body:
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/f/f3/Merdeglace.jpg)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mer_de_Glace)

## Our Climate Action, v1

> In summary 
&gt 
> The action screen has been completely redesigned with two paths and more gestures
> The application has been partially redesigned: it is more modern and pleasant to use, especially on cell phones
> we introduce *personas*, to better work on the next actions
> share your simulation result on the networks, and people will see directly a capture of your assessment!

## Take action

We have completely redesigned the /actions screen.

We now have access to two modes, one guided where the actions are classified by our care, and the other autonomous which allows to tackle the biggest gestures of reduction.

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-03-29 15-53-21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112846986-e5d75f00-90a6-11eb-8ca0-1be5736d5d9c.png)

The selection of gestures is now more complete, there are now 17, in all categories.

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-03-29 15-54-28](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112847173-161efd80-90a7-11eb-8f47-283dd1eb418a.png)


## Redesign of the application, especially on mobile

- we adopt the conventions of modern mobile, with navigation buttons accessible with the finger at the bottom, and a session bar that gives the result of simulation also at the bottom and permanent

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-03-29 11-05-15 resized](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112813673-c3c9e680-907e-11eb-94c9-b818073b7c45.png)

- on the action screen, the session bar remains predictable, in the same place but with the color of the category

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-03-29 11-07-12 resized](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112813831-f07dfe00-907e-11eb-9d4c-240dbaa7d74a.png)


- we have gained vertical space on mobile. Why is this important? To make phones < 6 inches last. Not because 6 inches is bad, but because changing phones just for the screen is a shame. It won't revolutionize our footprint, but it's something! 

Before  ! 
![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-03-29 10-52-39 resized](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112813510-8ebd9400-907e-11eb-8db7-e2291ed24eaa.png)
After
![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-03-29 10-52-51 resized](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112813516-8f562a80-907e-11eb-9ead-773133ff889c.png)


## Sharing simulation

Big new feature that allows to preview the results of a simulation when sharing on social networks 
We hope to improve the distribution of the application. Below, a Whatsapp capture.

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112972961-1d9ae100-9151-11eb-9f34-bc3061ca35da.png)


See [this PR](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/208).


 ## Introduction of personas

This system, to be populated with profiles if possible representative of the population, will allow us to better test and develop the application.

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-03-29 15-50-57](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112846716-a14bc380-90a6-11eb-8060-219bed3d3ddf.png)

## Bug fixes

We fixed a big bug: the "previous" button of the simulation was not working properly. We removed it, fixed the same problem that affected the "my answers" button, which now becomes the only way to change your answers. It has been widely promoted.

body:
> In brief 
> üöÄ This is the 1st beta version of Our Climate Gestures, released in June 2020.  

![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/65/Refuge_et_Pic_de_l'√âtendard_(Savoie).JPG/400px-Refuge_and_Pic_of_l'√âtendard_(Savoie).JPG)

It is essentially a rework of the 2.6 model of the MicMac tool from Avenir Climatique, which was a spreadsheet file to download 
MicMac Web was not updated anymore, it was necessary to launch a new version of the interface, more modern, interactive, easy to make evolve and making total transparency on the calculations 

This repository contains the complete calculation model of Our Climate Gestures, in the form of YAML files [publicodes](https://publi.codes).

The tool is in *beta* version: it is usable and already informative, but we have already identified many unsatisfactory points 
- the total is not the expected 11.2 tons
- the numerical part is not complete, the footprint is underestimated
- the only question for the diet is very disappointing
- etc.


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/89622912-0e9ab200-d894-11ea-9226-c4af37549cd7.png)

body:
[Glacier de las Neous (https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a8/Glacier_de_Las_N√©ous_8_ao√ªt_1905.png/547px-Glacier_de_Las_N√©ous_8_ao√ªt_1905.png) (https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier_de_las_N√©ous)

> In short :
> - a tutorial is displayed before the test
> - seasonal, local food
> - we help you to fill up your kilometers by car
> - many new content on the screen / actions
> - many other improvements to the model and the site

## A tutorial before the test üßëüè´

We've added a tutorial for those unfamiliar with the concept of climate footprints and personal consumption climate footprints. This is part of our strategy to reach out to audiences not yet aware of these topics.

[The Ministry of the Environment demos it here](https://twitter.com/i/status/1488059482647236608) 

## Seasonal, local food üåª üöõ

We developed climate footprint variation models from Agribalyse corresponding to seasonal and local diets 

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/140048614-299fc659-6c87-441c-ab91-4b79e7c44b11.gif)

These improvements are, to our knowledge, an unprecedented work! You will see that these "options" have little influence if your diet is not already strongly vegetarian 

## New screen to help with mileage entry while driving ‚å®Ô∏è üõ£Ô∏è

You may have noticed that it is difficult to answer the question "How many miles do you drive each year?" all at once 

So have we: so we've designed a form to help with that entry 

help to enter car km - demo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/151338682-c79c82d3-4582-4981-98ab-401dc8c81206.gif)

Big bonus: this form also avoids estimating a vehicle fill rate, which is usually a very risky task 

## Improvements of the "action" course üéØ

- two new actions to switch to seasonal and local food
- we improved the action to reduce housing temperature: we now ask for your current temperature
- a new action to go vegan
- we separated the actions into different ranges, from "more than a ton" to "less than 10kg", and finally to "unquantified actions" 

## Gas price üî•

You will surely have seen it: gas prices are exploding in France. Between +40% and +110% in a few months. So we have revised upwards our tool to help estimate kWh from ‚Ç¨/month 

To do so, we have reimplemented the gas bill at the regulated rate, including the various taxes and subscriptions that modify this figure.

## New profile page

A small button appears on the home page, it indicates that you already have data on nosgestesclimat.fr. As before, we have no data on our servers, everything is local on your browser 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/151852468-1e9d0cf1-a19e-4540-8c9a-2bf9beb0c6da.png)

Above all, the profile page has been revamped, it is now much easier to navigate through your answers 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/151852657-f06c1d34-fc05-4c4a-8d23-8304cacfc4ea.png)


## Ecodesign üèãÔ∏è

*Let's keep in mind that the footprint of the service and use of a website in France is very small and already in general naturally optimized by developers. The environmental impact of digital is mainly related to manufacturing [(70% e.g. for a smartphone)](https://librairie.ademe.fr/cadic/5311/infographie-preferer-smartphone-reconditionne.pdf?modal=false).*

### Small screens 

We continue to work to support small screens 

Here are the improvements on iPhone5 SE 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/144875622-2991b5a6-69c9-4c04-9422-48c727cc81af.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/144875673-c96e2098-22bb-4e71-b993-3c121fd008a6.png)

To do this, we have optimized the footprint distribution graph, by integrating the texts in the bars. It has also been animated, which makes it much easier to understand the impact of choices in the input 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/151852263-5fb7fe31-e13e-4ce5-96a8-4794d19f5ce7.png)


### Site hosting

We have [asked](https://answers.netlify.com/t/low-carbon-european-cdn/48784) our host (Netlify), if it would be possible for them to implement a server in France so that our users can see their site served from France, rather than from Germany currently 

## Coming in 2022

See our roadmap for the calculation model [here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/projects/1)

[![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/96420391-bf5af100-11f5-11eb-9662-fbcbd1445ea0.png)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier_d'Argenti√®re)

> In brief: introduction of action sheets and a better model of the car

## Integration of the action sheets 

After the simulation, we now offer you a list of actions that significantly reduce your footprint 

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-01-25 11-23-53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/105693284-d2b9de80-5eff-11eb-8229-9c7dfd4f2a63.png)

We have also integrated a detailed documentation for each of these actions 
![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-01-25 11-26-37](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/105693599-347a4880-5f00-11eb-94c2-51a179b8bd48.png)


## Big improvement of the model: the construction of the vehicle üöó 

It is now amortized over several years. Previously, it was amortized over age, so an electric car bought 1 year ago would have its 12 tons attributed to that first year all at once, among other problems 

The depreciation method is explained [here](https://ecolab.ademe.fr/apps/climat/documentation/transport/voiture/amortissement-particulier).

It was also forgotten to divide the construction of the vehicle by the number of passengers, as was done for the use of the car.

See #674 for all the thinking behind it.

## Other improvements ‚ú® 

It is clarified that we are asking for the energy consumption of the household, not the individual. This includes collocates who may each have their own amount in mind.

We improved the texts of the questions on cars, and better documented the calculations.

[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ed/Glacier_de_la_Grande_Casse_le_13_ao√ªt_2016.JPG/640px-Glacier_de_la_Grande_Casse_le_13_ao√ªt_2016.JPG)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier_des_Grands_Couloirs)

> In short: we listen to each of your feedbacks, and the improvement continues üîÑ


## üëÇ We are listening to you! 

We've sorted through and responded to over 300 pieces of feedback since the launch of Our Climate Action, all of which can be found on [the "issues" tab](https://github.com/betagouv/ecolab-data/issues).

This allows us to understand the problems of the calculator to prioritize its improvement.

## Some simulation improvements

üö¥ Cyclosphere, hello! Cycling makes an appearance in the simulator, and in the "go to work other than by car" action, which replaces "go to work by public transit". Walking üö∂‚ôÄÔ∏è and other modes are not left out obviously üõ¥.
![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-02-08 15-42-24](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/107234732-4097f700-6a24-11eb-9f54-ff64cf66183f.png)

We let you guess the impact that this quesiton has on the results ;) 

We have also improved the input guides (eg. number of houses: is it with or without me?)

ü§≥ The phone question has been revised, now that all recent phones are larger than 5 inches, and to take into account the 'no smartphone' option.

üî•üå≤ The heating in steres of wood question becomes more relevant: it's counted in steres, not kWh. We will continue to improve the other entries soon (wood in pellets, fuel oil).

## Other improvements 

New features (like this one you are reading) now appear directly on https://nosgestesclimat.fr/nouveaut√©s, it's still more accessible than [on github](https://github.com/betagouv/ecolab-data/releases) üôÇ 


üêõ Several quite important bugs have been solved thanks to your feedback (end of simulation always at 11 tons, default value input -> no "next" button, etc.)

## Our roadmap

Now that the "issues" onget is getting clearer, it was time to put our roadmap on the simulator / calculation model side, it's in the [Projects section](https://github.com/betagouv/ecolab-data/projects/1). Everything is indicative, but it allows you to know what our current topics are 

> As for the interface, it is rather [here](https://github.com/betagouv/ecolab-climat/milestones) that you should go to follow the progress.

body: [Glacier de G√©broulaz](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a4/Glacier_de_G√©broulaz2.jpg/640px-Glacier_de_G√©broulaz2.jpg)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier_de_G√©broulaz) > In brief : > - Arrival of the survey mode > - A new metric: oil > - Improvements in the calculation model : caravan, camping car, car fuel, digital ... > Improvements in the actions: buy an electric car, subsidy for the purchase of a bicycle > - New pedagogical resources ## Arrival of the survey mode! üíæ * **What is it? The "survey" mode in Our Climate Gestures allows several people to take the test while saving the data in a permanent way (total carbon footprint and by category). This mode can be particularly interesting in the context of a workshop or an event, a [facilitator's guide] (https://nosgestesclimat.fr/groupe/guide) is available to help you! ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/171632300-dba6d437-a9bd-44b3-afc3-874c1e7307d6.png) * **Survey customization*** The arrival of this new mode is a big step forward With the arrival of this new mode comes an additional feature that allows you to add a few questions to gather additional information as an introduction to the test. For example, this can be useful to organize a survey at the scale of an organization while allowing to filter the results by type of respondent (status...), age, place of living (while taking care of course not to compromise the standards of RGPD). We also worked on the security of the surveys to avoid the introduction of vulnerabilities in our database via this feature. You will find all the info in our [documentation](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/groupe/documentation-contexte) ! * **The group mode view page is better filtered In the previous version, any user who logged in to the survey appeared in the visualization graph. Some people counted as 1 participant without even having taken the test (with a score corresponding to the default values) and the ghost visits distorted the results (especially the average value!). This is no longer the case in this version since the data displayed is filtered by excluding users who completed less than 10% of the test questions. In case the survey is customized (see above), an additional filter is applied to display only participants who have completed the context questions. ## A new metric: oil! üõ¢ To better visualize the amount of oil we consume in our lives, we decided to add to Our Climate Gestures the corresponding number of full tanks, in addition to the CO‚ÇÇe. For the moment, this metric is reported only on direct oil-related emissions (travel, oil heating ...) The way to both highlight our dependence on these fossil fuels but also to better visualize the impact of actions we can put in place: the number of passages at the pump speaks more than the tons of CO‚ÇÇe, so swipe on the end screen to see your oil impact! ## Calculation model improvements üßÆ * **Added caravan & motorhome** There are now more choices in Our Climate Gestures for going on vacation! Caravans and motor homes have found their place. Please note that for caravans, the number of kilometers traveled is to be included in the kilometers traveled by car. More information on the methodology in issue #1317. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/160854704-aa5b1010-e8f9-43cb-966b-ba80e6a8f731.png) * **Change in passenger ratio With the arrival of the km input help in [the last release](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/nouveaut%C3%A9s/las-n%C3%A9ous), a question remained as to the choice of the vehicle fill rate applied to attribute the depreciation to the different users of the car. A reflection was made to finally change the ratio initially chosen, details are available in issue #1337 and in the [note of the variable "passenger ratio"](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/blob/8fe4b633502fe52dda7eccdc0e9db01b9f677e57/data/transport/transport%20.%20voiture.yaml#L53) * **More fuel choices Diesel (B7 or B10), gasoline (E5 or E10) or E85 gasoline (biofuels), you can choose! However, beware of the message sent to the user when selecting biofuels. The carbon impact is certainly lower, but the emission factor is particularly uncertain: the issues related to land use are not taken into account! A notification is therefore displayed to explain this issue! All the info and discussions are in the corresponding issue #1396! * **Improvement of the digital mosaic New objects have been added for the digital mosaic #1359 : - üéµ bluetooth speaker - üîä voice speaker - ‚åöÔ∏è connected watch - üïπ living room console - üéÆ portable console * **New heating modes** Heat pump (#1360) can now be selected! Thoughts are underway to add heat networks as well. ## Improvements in actions üí™ * **A "Buy an electric car" action is making its appearance** Proposed in case you already own a car, this action allows users to realize the impact (positive or negative) of buying a new or used electric car according to the kilometers driven per year. * **Addition of mesaidesvelo.fr in the actions Add a link to [mesaidesvelo.fr](https://mesaidesvelo.fr/) in the relevant actions. The tool is developed by @mquandalle, who is a developer on mon-entreprise.fr, and mesaidesvelo.fr is already integrated on the official website [https://www.1jeune1solution.gouv.fr/](https://www.1jeune1solution.gouv.fr/). ## A new way to contribute üë• Contributing is made easier for non-devs contributors! Repositories have been configured to allow you to modify or add new features in real time via a development environment directly in your browser. We explain everything in the [Gitpod tutorial](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#vous-voulez-contribuer-comme-un-pro) ! ## New resources üìö In order to help you during your animations but also to allow you to question your own results, [guide sheets are online](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/groupe/guide)! **Full Changelog**: https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/compare/1.5.0...1.6.0

> In short: Power, average footprint and some bugs

For this 2nd version of Our Climate Gestures, we listened to the already numerous feedbacks and made these main changes.

## Food item

We introduce the choice of the type of breakfast 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/91868807-6ea72d00-ec75-11ea-81bb-982cac0ea55a.png)

As well as a new diet selector, much less rigid than a single diet.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/91868962-9c8c7180-ec75-11ea-86fc-2f12f26baf35.png)

## More representative default values

The simulator, by default, now indicates 11.7 tons, a figure closer to the average footprint of a French person (we were previously at 10) 

## Removal of the "finance" item

As explained in #24 , assigning a footprint to the money we have in the bank was double counting. We have removed it.

## üêõ shared car bug

In short, we were significantly overestimating the footprint of the shared car rental.

We now attribute a share of the vehicle's construction to each person who rents a car to get around. We were making the mistake of attributing *all* of the construction to him

> This glacier of Tr√©-la-T√™te is the 4th largest glacier in France. An üìΩÔ∏è [interesting Brut video about it following the unusual summer of 2022 (29/07/2022)](https://www.francetvinfo.fr/meteo/canicule/video-un-glaciologue-repond-a-cinq-questions-sur-les-glaciers_5283679.html)

> **In brief** 
> - new logo, new iconography, new homepage 
> - a lot of small improvements to the site and the calculation model

## üé® A new logo, a new homepage, and new icons

You won't have missed it, Our Climate Gestures is getting a new logo ü•≥ 

![](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/images/petit-logo.png)

Frequently quoted in the press, it will go even less unnoticed 

<details><summary>Here are some excerpts from the last two weeks alone ‚¨áÔ∏è  </summary></details>

Article from [Ouest-France](https://www.ouest-france.fr/bretagne/carhaix-plouguer-29270/a-carhaix-ces-specialistes-de-l-energie-donnent-leurs-conseils-pour-consommer-moins-bc1250aa-3346-11ed-8dd8-fdb9fa809eb1): In Carhaix, these energy specialists give their advice to consume less

> It is also possible to calculate its carbon footprint on nosgestesclimat.fr

Article from [France Inter](https://www.radiofrance.fr/franceinter/un-champion-de-trail-nous-explique-pourquoi-il-renonce-a-une-course-en-raison-de-son-bilan-carbone-7787049) : A high level runner explains why he gives up the Worlds because of his carbon footprint 

> Andy Symonds has calculated, via the website "Nos gestes climat", that flying to Thailand would explode his carbon footprint.

 Le Dauphin√© Lib√©r√© [launched a poll and quotes NGC](https://www.ledauphine.com/environnement/2022/09/21/les-citoyens-attendent-que-l-etat-les-accompagne-dans-leurs-efforts) Find the results of our poll "The French and their carbon footprint" 

> A French person emits on average 11.2 tons of CO2e per year. Experts estimate that this figure should be limited to 2 tons per year to slow down climate change and respect the objectives of the Paris Agreement. To find out your carbon footprint, Ademe has launched an online tool called "Our climate actions".

As well as [outside.fr](https://www.outside.fr/comment-evaluer-votre-empreinte-carbone-les-3-meilleurs-calculateurs).



The home page follows this graphic evolution with a few paragraphs to introduce the subject (and its limits) 



### Before 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/191323489-088461c2-b1b9-46fe-bce2-c1e459104569.png)

### After

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/191323550-993c5109-ae91-4baa-8853-af240bf4c279.png)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/191323669-952493a1-7b17-4d38-a48b-313f2a592863.png)



In the same way, we have worked on the [style and readability of the icons](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/570) throughout the site.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/192312016-67af3382-6e02-49db-b791-8ba1702eb0ce.png)


## üêé Performance (eco-design)

We finished phase 2 of our sobriety work, in terms of site weight, with a [significant gain](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/602). It's all relative, but a little sobriety on our end is the least we can do!

## üëÜÔ∏è Other interface improvements

- The [survey mode](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/groupe) is no longer in beta, it has already been used by hundreds of organizations
- a notification appears when your home is depreciated (= built a long time ago): in this case, we do not ask you its surface in particular (because we do not need it for the calculation), this surprised some users
- the input of numbers in the questionnaire is now more constrained (you can't enter zero passengers in the car for example) to reduce the errors that can cause non-expected values (infinite or null values)
- the button "I don't know" appears in the mosaics (https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/604)
- the accessibility certificate (https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/621) is online, testifying to our work on this important aspect of Web sites

Globally, an important work has been done on the sorting and closing of hundreds of return tickets, [on the model side](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/issues) as well as [on the site side](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/issues), the contribution of the greatest number of people is still our priority.

## üßÆ Model side

- update of [aircraft emission factors](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/1489)
- the "consumption" part of the tea [is already included in your electricity bill](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/1494), it was a bug spotted thanks to our work in parallel on [monconvertisseurco2.fr](https://monconvertisseurco2.fr/empreinte-carbone/boisson)
- the emission factor of the French electricity mix for 2021 [is updated](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/1484)

## üåÖ Coming soon...

We are currently working on a regionalization (overseas) and internationalization of the site üòé. See you soon!
